Collection.LongName: UAVSAR Repeat Pass Interferometry Ground Projected Amplitude Scene
Collection.Description: UAVSAR Repeat Pass Interferometry Ground Projected Amplitude Scene
Collection.ProcessingLevelDescription: UAVSAR Repeat Pass Interferometry Scene contains calibrated complex cross products projected to the ground in simple geographic coordinates (latitude, longitude). There is a fixed number of looks for each pixel. Floating point, little endian, 8 or 4 bytes per pixel.

Instrument.LongName: Uninhabited Aerial Vehicle Synthetic Aperture Radar

AdditionalAttribute.Name: FLIGHT_LINE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Flight line identifies where the aircraft/instument has flown to acquire data.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: GROUP_ID
AdditionalAttribute.Description: ID that helps ASF group products

AdditionalAttribute.Name: OFF_NADIR_ANGLE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The angle the sensor points away from the satellite's nadir (off to the side. Larger angles correspond to imaging farther away from the satellite.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: MD5SUM
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Checksum

AdditionalAttribute.Name: GRANULE_TYPE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Identifies the type of data by combining platform, beam mode type, and coverage (frame/swath

AdditionalAttribute.Name: ASCENDING_DESCENDING
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Describes whether the satellite travel direction was ascending towards the north pole, or descending towards the south pole.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: FAR_END_LAT
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: INSAR_STACK_SIZE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The number of SAR images over the same location in the entire ASF archive. Used for data that may be used for interferometry.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: BEAM_MODE_TYPE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: In most cases the same as beam mode. For Radarsat indicates both resolution and off-nadir pointing angle. Standard beam mode becomes ST1 though ST7 beammodetype, with ST7 pointing farthest from the satellite.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: INSAR_BASELINE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The perpendicular distance between two satellites when they took the related two images. Useful for identifying image pairs to use for interferometry.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: CENTER_FRAME_ID
AdditionalAttribute.Description: ID of the center frame

AdditionalAttribute.Name: CENTER_ESA_FRAME
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The Europenan Space Agency equivalent to the value in the FRAME_NUMBER field

AdditionalAttribute.Name: ACQUISITION_DATE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Date the data was acquired by the satellite or aircraft + instrument.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: MISSION_NAME
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The sitenames where AIRSAR, AIMOSS, and UAVSAR acqusitions were taken.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: CENTER_LON
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Longitude of the center of the scene or frame.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: NEAR_START_LAT
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: BEAM_MODE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The general type of active sensor used. Values indicate image resolution: such as standard, fine, wide, scansar wide, SM (strip mode, EW(extra wide. OR indicate resolution + polarization: FBS (fine beam dual polarization, FBD (fine beam dual pol. OR atipically the type of product: TOPSAR (high resolution DEM, RPI (repeat pass interferometry, XTI (across track interferometry. OR resolution and product type IW (interferometric wide.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: BEAM_MODE_DESC
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Text that describes the beam mode

AdditionalAttribute.Name: PROCESSING_TYPE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Indicates the type of product, such as browse, metadata, L1, complex, amplitude, projected, terrain corrected.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: PROCESSING_DESCRIPTION
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Describes what the data was processed to. For example: low resolution terrain corrected ALOS data.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: FRAME_NUMBER
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The designated frame or scene as defined by various space agencies (ESA, JAXA, CSA each of which have their own scheme. The frame describes a box over the Earth at a fixed latitude. Combined with a path number (for longitude it identifies a specific piece of ground.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: PROCESSING_LEVEL
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Indicates how much processing has been done to the data: L1, L1.0 unprocessed; L1.1 single look complex; L1, L1.5 amplitude image

AdditionalAttribute.Name: PROCESSING_DATE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The date the data was processed

AdditionalAttribute.Name: NEAR_START_LON
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging began nearest the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: DOPPLER
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The doppler centroid frequency - Useful for sar processing and interferometry. Related to the squint of the satellite.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: FAR_START_LAT
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: NEAR_END_LON
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: PROCESSING_TYPE_DISPLAY
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Label that will be displayed in ASF's Vertex interface

AdditionalAttribute.Name: POLARIZATION
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Radar transmissions are polarized, with components normally termed vertical (V and horizontal (H. Vertical means that the electric vector is in the plane of incidence; horizontal means the electric vector is perpendicular to the plane of incidence.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: FAR_START_LON
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: THUMBNAIL_URL
AdditionalAttribute.Description: URL that points to this granule's thumbnail image

AdditionalAttribute.Name: ASF_PLATFORM
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Internal ASF platform name

AdditionalAttribute.Name: INSAR_STACK_ID
AdditionalAttribute.Description: An ASF-assigned unique number used internally to unifiy SAR images over the same location. Used for data that might be used for interferometry.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: LOOK_DIRECTION
AdditionalAttribute.Description: SAR imagery is taken with the sensor pointing either left or right of the satellite. Most data is right-looking. A small amount of Radarsat is left-looking.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: PATH_NUMBER
AdditionalAttribute.Description: The path describes a path the satellite will follow over the earth similar to longitude; each path has an assigned number. Combined with a frame number is identifies a specific piece of ground.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: NEAR_END_LAT
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging ended nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: FARADAY_ROTATION
AdditionalAttribute.Description: An effect of the ionisphere that rotates polarizations from HH or VV or HV or VH. Significant for L or P band. Rotation over 5 degrees reduces usefulness for applications such as forest biomass. Effect is reduced at solar minimum.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: FAR_END_LON
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: BYTES
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Product size in bytes.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: CENTER_LAT
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Latitude of the center of the scene or frame.

Campaign.ShortName: San Andreas Fault - Salton Trough, CA
San Andreas Fault - LA Basin, CA

OnlineAccessURL.URLDescription: The ASF Search and Ordering Interface
